desc: Giuseppe Castiglione [Public domain], via Wikimedia Commons

By A collaboration between Chinese and European painters. The Jesuit missionaries involved in producing the drawings in China were Giuseppe Castiglione, Jean-Denis Attiret, Ignace Sichelbart and Jean Damascene. The engravings were executed in Paris under the direction of Charles-Nicolas Cochin of the Académie Royal at the Court of Louis XVI and the individual engravers include Le Bas, Aliamet, Prevot, Saint-Aubin, Masquelier, Choffard, and Launay. (http://www.battle-of-qurman.com.cn/e/hist.htm) [Public domain], via Wikimedia Commons

desc: Japanese clock melted by WWII nuclear bomb. On display in the War Memorial museum, Canberra, Australia. The hands apparently show the time of the explosion. The infocard described the glass face as being melted by the blast (you can see it dripping at the bottom), and said the clock was found near the centre of the explosion. It did not specify Hiroshima or Nagasaki
exifDesc: Japanese clock melted by WWII nuclear bomb. On display in the War Memorial museum, Canberra, Australia. The hands apparently show the time of the explosion. The infocard described the glass face as being melted by the blast (you can see it dripping at the bottom), and said the clock was found near the centre of the explosion. It did not specify Hiroshima or Nagasaki.

desc: Atomic cloud over Nagasaki from Koyagi-jima by Hiromichi Matsuda\n9 August 1945
exifDesc: Atomic cloud over Nagasaki from Koyagi-jima by Hiromichi Matsuda 9 August 1945
credit: Include source: Мир вокруг нас через объектив, originally (The atomic bomb mushroom cloud over Nagasaki on August 9, 1945 in the Nagasaki Atomic Bomb Museum.)

desc: The Second World War 1939 - 1945- the War in the Far East 1941 - 1945\nThe mushroom cloud over Nagasaki, photographed from an escorting American B-29 aircraft "The Big Stink", after the atomic bomb had been dropped by United States Air Force B-29 "Bock's Car" on 9 August 1945. The Japanese Supreme War Council agreed later the same day to accept the Potsdam Declaration of 26 July 1945 which demanded the unconditional surrender of Japan.
exifDesc: The Second World War 1939 - 1945- the War in the Far East 1941 - 1945. The mushroom cloud over Nagasaki, photographed from an escorting American B-29 aircraft "The Big Stink", after the atomic bomb had been dropped by United States Air Force B-29 "Bock's Car" on 9 August 1945. The Japanese Supreme War Council agreed later the same day to accept the Potsdam Declaration of 26 July 1945 which demanded the unconditional surrender of Japan.
